title: The mutation burden of narrowband ultraviolet B phototherapy (NB-UVB) in human skin; relevance to NB-UVB lifetime exposures and skin cancer surveillance
details: JC Fowler, RK Sood, G Coltart, C Lai, N Nadarajah… - British Journal of …, 2025
abstract: Background Ultraviolet radiation (UVR) is used as treatment for psoriasis and other skin diseases, but UVR can induce DNA mutations which may lead to skin cancer development. While skin cancers have been documented in patients treated with …

title: Plaque‐Like Dermatofibroma: A Case Report and a Review of the Literature With a Focus on Dermoscopy
details: F Cavallo, U Santaniello, F Santoro, P Dapavo, P Fava… - JEADV Clinical Practice, 2025
abstract: Plaque‐like dermatofibroma (PLDF) is a rare clinical variant of dermatofibroma (DF), characterised by flat, infiltrative lesions, often larger than 50 mm in diameter and located on the trunk or lower extremities. A 44‐year‐old male presented to our clinic …
